pullrequest.title: Refined the requirements for inertia matrix.

content.raw:
This is a good start. The inertia matrix definitely must be positive definite, which limits the magnitude of the off-diagonal terms relative to the diagonal terms.

There is also another condition that governs the relative magnitudes of the diagonal terms, known as the triangle inequality:
~~~
Ixx + Iyy >= Izz
Iyy + Izz >= Ixx
Izz + Ixx >= Iyy
~~~
Physically, I think this means that the inertia matrix should by positive definite even after being rotated by arbitrary rotation matrices. Also, it has a straightforward proof. This is especially important when using Simbody, since it will assert if an inertia is supplied that doesn't satisfy the triangle inequality.

I will approve this, but I guess we can add a little bit more as well about the triangle inequality.
